title: Ideal Room Layout Design Competition
description: A design competition focused on planning the layout of an ideal room using spatial planning and aesthetics.
overview: DesCon plans to organize a design competition focused on planning the layout of an ideal room. Participants will apply principles of spatial planning, ergonomics, functionality, and aesthetics using drafting or modeling tools, promoting creativity and practical design thinking.
agenda: Drafting layout using CAD or modeling tools
Final submission of layout and renderings

title: Blender Workshop
description: Introduction to 3D modeling, texturing, and rendering workflows using Blender.
overview: A Blender workshop was conducted to introduce students to 3D modeling, texturing, and rendering workflows. The session complemented DesCon’s modeling-focused projects and competitions by providing practical exposure to industry-relevant visualization tools. Number of participants: 25 students.
takeaways: Confidence in using Blender for design

title: MATLAB Workshop
description: A workshop to familiarize students with basic scripting, data handling, and visualization techniques in MATLAB.
overview: A MATLAB workshop was conducted to familiarize students with basic scripting, data handling, and visualization techniques. The session supported participants involved in analytical and AI-driven projects, particularly those related to computational modeling and infrastructure analysis. Number of participants: 45 students.
takeaways: Ability to process and visualize data

title: AutoCAD Basics Workshop
description: Beginner-friendly hands-on workshop introducing 2D drafting and basic 3D modelling using AutoCAD.
overview: An introductory workshop designed to help students understand how real-world designs begin as digital drawings. Participants explored AutoCAD’s interface, practiced essential 2D tools, and took their first steps into basic 3D modelling. Number of participants: 25 students.
takeaways: Confidence using AutoCAD for academic work

title: Model Mania – Character to Life
description: A 3D character modelling competition where participants were challenged to bring characters to life using Blender or other 3D software.
overview: Model Mania was a week-long modelling competition where participants were challenged to bring characters to life using Blender or other 3D modelling software. The competition encouraged creativity, technical proficiency, and originality in digital design. Number of submissions: 15.
